Other Answers (6) Show: All Answers Oldest to Newest Newest to Oldest Rated Highest to Lowest by sean C Member since: 13 January 2009 Total points: 4,632 (Level 4) Add Contact Block From experience, I can tell you it definitely does. If I even picked up a pizza, then washed my hands (thoroughly), any left over residue would cause me to break out. The oil (from the burger fryer or deep fryer) gets absorbed into you skin, then when you touch your face, you push the oil from your hands into your pores. My advice (and this was seconded by my dermatologist), use a fork as much as possible and wash with dishsoap (she recommended using AJAX grapefruit dishsoap--->not the orange scent, it contains different chemicals<---, just put a travel size amount in one of those tiny Germ X bottles you see at the Wal-Mart check-out and wash up after eating). I've been doing this for a couple of years now and it has really helped. When you go to a fast food restaurant and get a burger or any other finger food, let it sit on a napkin for a minute or two to absorb the grease. At night, use Witch Hazel astringent to wash your face (after using natural soap such as dove), it's good for your skin and can stop break-out before they start. I haven't had a break-out in almost two years, except when I went to Carl's Junior, but I actually expected that. Obviously, different people will tell you different things, but I had to learn the hard way. Keep your hands and face clean. 3 years ago Report Abuse by Dee Member since: 21 July 2008 Total points: 5,988 (Level 5) Add Contact Block No, that is false. Food does no make you break out or cause acne. However; good vitamins and oils such as fish oils like omegas make the skin healthier.
*edit* I can tell you this much, acne is a condition in the pores...the oil glands. Not by getting burger grease on your face! Thats called having dirty hands and pusing bacteria in the pores! Source(s): I am a licensed esthetician, I do skin care for a living. 3 years ago Report Abuse
